definitions.definition: A transliteration of the Ancient Greek male given name Ἄρειος ( Áreios ) , Arius , notably borne by Arius , circa 250–336, a priest in Alexandria, the founder of Arianism .

main_definition: A transliteration of the Ancient Greek male given name Ἄρειος ( Áreios ) , Arius , notably borne by Arius , circa 250–336, a priest in Alexandria, the founder of Arianism .
